message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

The paper proposes a methodology for optimizing the energy-efficiency of machine-learning classifiers for image recognition tasks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a programmable and scalable Neuromorphic Engine (NeuE) for executing the FALCON based classifier models, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses the use of machine learning algorithms and the construction of a tree of classifiers, which falls under the categories of cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach for a 12-object classification task on the Caltech101 dataset and 10-object task on CIFAR-10 dataset, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia).
